'''Simisear''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''バオッキー''' ''Baokkie'') is a {{type|Fire}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Pansear}} when exposed to a [[Fire Stone]].

==Biology==
Simisear is a simian Pokémon that is primarily red. Its ears are broad with orange insides, and it has oval eyes and a small black nose. It has a swirled, flame-like tuft on its head with a smaller tuft on either side of it. Simisear has white shoulder ruffs, and a cream-colored face, chest, fingers and toes. Its hands have five fingers, and its feet have three toes. Its fluffy, swirled tail resembles a flame. There is a flame inside its body, which it fuels with sweet foods. It is also capable of scattering embers from its tail and the tufts on its head.

==In the anime==
[[File:Simisear anime.png|thumb|250px|left|Simisear in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Simisear debuted in ''[[BW025|Emolga and the New Volt Switch!]]''. It was knocked out of a tree by a group of {{p|Watchog}} and took its anger out on {{TP|Iris|Emolga}}, {{TP|Iris|Axew}}, and {{AP|Oshawott}} before the former and {{AP|Snivy}} saved it from a falling boulder.

===Minor appearances===
A Simisear briefly appeared in ''[[BW071|Search for the Clubultimate!]]'', under the ownership of [[Getty]]. It participated in a match against Betty's {{p|Simipour}} but was defeated.

A Simisear appeared in ''[[XY021|A PokéVision of Things to Come!]]''.

A Simisear appeared in ''[[XY026|A Battle by Any Other Name!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Simisear appeared in ''[[XY080|Performing with Fiery Charm!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Simisear shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Fletchinder}}. They are both known as the Ember Pokémon.
* Simisear ranked last in the Japanese [http://www.pokemon-movie.jp/election/ Pokémon general election 720] (Japanese: '''ポケモン総選挙720''') poll to decide what would be distributed at Japanese showings of ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]''.

===Origin===
Simisear is based on a {{wp|monkey}} and a {{wp|flame}}, though its midsection's pattern, cloud- or steam-like appendages and flame-like appendages make it similar in appearance to an {{wp|active volcano}}. Simisear eating sweets for its fire within its body to burn could be based on the effects of {{wp|carbohydrates}} giving energy for the body. It, along with its two contemporaries, seem to inspired by the {{wp|three wise monkeys}} motif; with its large ears, Simisear represents "hear no evil".

====Name origin====
Simisear may be a combination of ''{{wp|simian}}'', ''sear'', and ''ear''. ''Ear'' may relate to the "{{wp|three wise monkeys}}" motif of the [[elemental monkeys]].

Baokkie may be a combination of 爆 ''bào'' (Chinese for ''burst/explode''), バースト ''bāsuto'' (burst), and {{wp|monkey}}. It may also involve けっき ''kekki'' (vigor).
